Train Wreck was unable to avoid the missile and it exploded on him. Somethi=
ng was obviously incinerated since little crumbles of whatever it was dropp=
ed to the ground below. Train Wreck didn't care, though. He aimed his large=
 missiles launcher at Shockwave, deciding his target. He fired 2 missiles..=
...AT SHOCKWAVE! Whew, that was close...

  ----- Original Message ----- 
 =
 From: KSLawdogg@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, July=
 16, 2001 5:57 PM
  Subject: Shockwave & Unitron


  (Unitron and Shockwave=
 are a few hundred feet in the air and it would be easy 
  for them to see =
someone jumping at them with a sword.

  And Deadeye Duck owns Bucky O'Hare=
.  What was the name of that cool robot who 
  worked for the Toadies?)

  =
Shockwave/Unitron:



  "All are inferior to Decepticons.  They cannot defe=
at eons of experience."

  After Shockwave stated that simple fact loud eno=
ugh for anyone to hear, the 
  space fighter that was his current mode did =
some sharp maneuvers, avoiding 
  the missiles, but three of Hot Rod's lase=
rs dug into his left wing, not 
  piercing it though.  He returned fire wti=
h two missiles, splitting apart, one 
  heading for Windlord and the other =
for Train Wreck.

  ---

  Unitron avoided the missiles relatively easily, =
some shrapnel digging into 
  his back fins but it wasn't to bad.  He was a=
ble to easily avoid the incoming 
  robot, Aerotaur, but two of the robot's=
 lasers struck his space fighter form 
  in the side, barely missing some v=
ital parts.

  "Maximal filth." he cursed, firing off fifteen rapid lasers =
at Hot Rod and 
  making a u-turn in the air that put some pressure on his =
engines, launching 
  off a missile at Aerotaur as he adjusted his course s=
o he was no longer 
  flying towards him.

  "Shall I call the Ramora for a=
id?" Unitron asked via comm. with Shockwave.

  "Unneccessary.  We shall co=
ntact Firestarter only when he is needed."

   

  Your use of Yahoo! Group=
s is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
